author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Central and State governments should take necessary legal steps to ensure the conduct of jallikattu, Pattali Makkal Katchi youth wing president Anbumani Ramadoss, said at an event in Coimbatore on Tuesday.

Addressing reporters on the sidelines of the meeting the party-affiliated NGO Pasumai Thayagam had organised with industry representatives, Mr. Ramadoss wanted the State Government to convene an all-party meeting to discuss the Supreme Court Tuesday’s stay on the conduct the bull sport.

The parties should also represent the issue to the Prime Minister to have the court stay vacated.

In the past four years, the industrial development in the State had taken a beating. Sixty per cent of micro and small industries had shut shop. Inadequate power supply, industrial policies were among the reasons for the industry suffering.

Mr. Anbumani also said that in the past four years investment worth Rs. 65,000 crore that was to be made in the State had gone to other states. Taking a dig at the Makkal Nala Kootani, he said that the number of constituent was decreasing by the day. Earlier, the number of parties in the front was five. Now it was four.

The PMK was open to an alliance that did not have either the Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam or the All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam and with only those parties that accepted his candidature for chief ministership.
title: Convene all-party meet to discuss jallikattu ban: Anbumani Ramadoss
